meanings.definition: Imitation marble made from selenite or gypsum and pigments.
meanings.sent1: The scagliola on the table looked so real.
meanings.sent2: The scagliola columns in the building added elegance.
meanings.sent3: The scagliola countertop fooled everyone into thinking it was real marble.
meanings.sent4: Her scagliola artwork was a masterpiece of deception.
meanings.sent5: The scagliola flooring gleamed like polished stone under the lights.

meanings.definition: The technique of creating decorative plasterwork resembling marble.
meanings.sent1: Learning the art of scagliola requires patience and precision.
meanings.sent2: The artisan demonstrated the scagliola process to the students.
meanings.sent3: His scagliola skills were so good, he could make plain walls look like marble.
meanings.sent4: The scagliola technique transformed the room into a luxurious space.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of scagliola lies in its ability to mimic expensive materials.

meanings.definition: An object or surface made using scagliola.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed a scagliola vase from the 18th century.
meanings.sent2: The scagliola tabletop was a focal point of the room.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally chipped the scagliola statue, revealing its true material.
meanings.sent4: The scagliola mirror reflected light beautifully in the room.
meanings.sent5: The scagliola ornamentation on the walls added a touch of luxury to the space.
